trans-unit.source: Formats ASP.NET health monitoring event information.
ASP.NET health monitoring allows production and operations staff to manage deployed Web applications.
The <xref:System.Web.Management> namespace contains the health-event types responsible for packaging application health-status data and the provider types responsible for processing this data.
It also contains supporting types that help during the management of health events.

The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> is a supporting type used to uniformly format event-related information, which is useful if the event data must be logged and later presented to the user..
Instances of the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> class are passed as arguments to the formatting methods defined by the health-event types.
Appends the specified string and a carriage return to the event information.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.AppendLine%2A> method allows you to customize the event information by adding your own event-specific data.
The string to add to the event information.
Gets or sets the indentation level.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.IndentationLevel%2A> property allows you to control how the event information is indented.
The base unit of indentation is defined by the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> property.
For each indentation level, you increase the indentation one tab.
The number of tabs used for the indentation level.
Gets or sets the tab size.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> property allows you to control the tab size used when writing event information.

The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.TabSize%2A> determines the number of spaces per unit of indentation, controlled by <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.IndentationLevel%2A> property.
The number of spaces in a tab.
Returns the event information in string format.
The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter> uses an internal <xref:System.Text.StringBuilder> variable to store the event information.
This <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventFormatter.ToString%2A> method allows you to get all the information in a string format.
The event information.
